 I'll pipe in just to keep the thread alive. My team, the Patriots is rebuilding so they didn't make it this year. And I hate our chief adversaries the Colts. So I'm pulling for the Saints even though I think they're a pack of bullying thugs on the field. I think they play dirty and what they did to Favre brought my blood to a boil. That should let you know how much I can't stand the Manning's and the Colts to still be pulling for them.

Tossing a Pigskin is an abomination. There goes the NFL..... Oh and I'm more of a Baseball fan. Maybe my Dodgers will pull it off next season that is if there's a team left by the time the dust settles from the owner's divorce....

Thanks guys for trying to keep the thread going. Don't want to offend anybody, but the responses were rather luke warm. 
 
 I just happen to like sports, period!
 
 Tennis, curling, golf, soccer, ice skating, football, summer and winter olympics, etc. etc. etc. There is one lonely exception, basket ball. Very boring and tedious to watch except the last 45 seconds in a close match.
 
 See you around sports fans. I am going to watch the super bowl. May the best team win.

 I haven't followed it much but I'm sure my uncle has. When I go for a spin in my dads 505 hp GTO it feels like a drag racer emoticon_xgood
 
 One thing I love about my partner is he's an old fashioned country car nut that loves fast cars :)
 
 Fastest I've gone is 145 in my 323i going from Norfolk to Pascagoula. It was going through Georgia where they have hedgerows on the median so you can't see oncoming traffic.
 
 Was like around 2 am and no one was on the road. Plus I have my radar to detect cops.
 
 I've never been so scared/ thrilled ever. Never went that fast again. What's shocking is even at that speed the car drove like I was doing 80!

From football to fast cars. Interesting.

 Let's see. a 12 point Cr/Mo roll cage, 4-caliper rear brakes, a parachute, a 5-point safety harness, transmission shield, driveshaft safety loop, a helmet and a firesuit........but no Depends. If you need Depends, you'd better not climb in the driver's seat. It's a definite E Ticket ride, especially when the rear wheels are hooking and you're watching the sky instead of the track as your front wheels get higher and higher off the ground. emoticon_xgood

 Well yeah... but I like the idea of a safety harness and all that good stuff too...

Well yeah... but I like the idea of a safety harness and all that good stuff too...

 
 The NHRA and IHRA require increasing levels of safety gear as you go faster and faster. There are also varying licenses required as well. The first licensed class allows you to run under 10 seconds in the 1/4 mile. Above that, you don't need any license.
